args: I'm off to work, Sheila. When I return,\nlet us...let us speak. All right?
You'll wait for me here, won't you?\nI won't be long.
...All right, we'll end our morning training\nsession there.
I noticed that as well. I wonder what's\nweighing on his mind.
(I've fancied myself a man of the world,\nbut for all my travels and study I remain\nblind and ignorant.)
(Especially when it comes to knowing\nthe mind of those I hold most dear.)
Sent here and not my home?
The courier said he came here when\nno one answered your door, sir.
(But Sheila should be there.\nDid she just not respond?)
I see. Thank you for seeing it to me.
＂My dear friend Gatov,\nI was delighted to hear from you after so long.＂

＂You spoke of worries regarding your daughter,
but the love and care you bear her is clear as
day in your writing. If anything, I fear such
singular dedication has placed you at odds
with your own heart in other matters.＂

＂The Gatov I know would not turn a blind eye to
the plight of Grams's slums, no more than he
was able to turn away the refugees who once
sought peace in his kingdom.＂
＂Sheila grew up watching that noble man.\nWhatever she may have lost since then,\nsurely that memory still resides within her.＂
＂I have all faith she remembers her father\nas the defender of the defenseless.＂
They see hope in our kingdom and risk\ntheir lives to reach our gates. I welcome\na people so brave and determined.
That is my decision both as Lefkos's king,\nand as a human being who has tasted\nthe cruel bite of pain and loss.
Father, might I help with the\nresettlement planning?
I am part of Lefkos's royal family as well,\nand your daughter above that.
(Perhaps she does yet retain some\nmemory of the man her father once was.)
(If so, the man she sees now must\nappear to be...)
Urgent report, sir! Fiends have appeared\nin the slums!
The crack in that wall spread to the point\nthey were able to slip through!
The Templars' response will take some\ntime yet, so they've requested we go\nand do what we can!
Those damnable curs! To think they'd drag\ntheir heels in a crisis like this!
We haven't the time to complain.\nPrepare to move out at once.
Do not suffer a single fiend to escape!
Quite a number made it in...\nWhat?! She's here...!
I'm relieved you are both safe.\nBut what are you doing here, Sheila?
Helping all of us! The hole in the wall\ngot bigger, so we were trying to fix it.
She was walking by and came over\nto try and help us block it.
Sheila, you've been coming to this place?\nAiding those who live here?
(This is the first time she's taken action of\nher own accord since losing herself.)
(I feared she was completely numb\nto everything, but...)
I see you can yet feel the desire to help\nothers, as someone who has known pain,\nand as my daughter.
Hmph. It seems those fiends have\nmore or less been dealt with.
I see the Templars finally deigned to make\ntheir grand appearance.
This operation is now under Templar\ncontrol. We can't permit the royal guard\nto seize all the glory, now can we?
More fiends yet remain, and there are\nserious injuries among the citizens here.
We must dedicate all the forces we have to\nsaving the city—Templar and guard alike.

Any further action will be regarded as
usurpation of Church authority!
Keep flapping your gums and I'll have
you dismissed for obstruction.
Someone help! My house caught fire\nin the attack!
My brother is hurt! We need a doctor!
We don't have time to deal with you lot!\nCan't you see we're busy slaying fiends?!
(The Templars are entirely blind to the\nsuffering of these people.)
(They care only for shielding themselves\nfrom the consequences of their own\ncallous negligence.)
(If matters are left to them, lives will be\nlost. There is only one choice left...)
Of course, girl. Now come.\nWe've work to do.
What are you playing at, Gatov?! If you\ninsist on making a nuisance of your—
If you are so eager for my resignation,\nbe my guest. People suffer before me.\nI will do what I can—what I MUST.

In the end, we managed to keep casualties to a
minimum. The outer wall was mended and the
incident passed, but the fundamental problems
remained unchanged.
Shortly after this, I resigned my post as a\nspecial advisor to the royal guard.
